page.title: 13ST MARK'S BIGGIN HILL
page.content:
THE MOVING CHURCH
The Reverend Vivian Symons owned Saint Marks Church, it was a poor shabby iron building. In those days only a few people used it, but Biggin Hill had grown and spread and a larger Church was needed. A new stone Church would cost thousands and thousands of pounds. Mr.Symons thought he could not possibly collect all that, but he did not give up hope. One day he would build a new Church at Biggin Hill. Then he heard of a Church in London that was going to be taken down, so he asked if he could move the Church that was in Peckham to Biggin Hill and he was allowed. He started to move it brick by brick and in 1959 it was finished.
